intro: Clidemia dolichantha, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine, silky hairs. Clidemia dolichantha is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
